name: Chomp Chomp Thai kitchen
address: 78 E 1st St, New York, NY 10009, USA

reviews.text: Little place but the food was good

The first time my foot stepped into this restaurant, I senses an extremely horrible smell. This food taste is ok; however, the quantity is definitely insufficient. In addition, they charge 2 bucks fora tiny little cup of rice. If I got any other choices, I would never come here for a meal.
They charged my phone, very kind,  changed our order becusde my daughter's are indecisive very accommodating and relaxing

Decided to try this place cus the night eating.  The green curry with chicken at lunch special did not deliver‚Ä¶ curry flavor was good, but the chicken in it is very very plain‚Ä¶ I guess the chef cooked them separately and simply dump them‚Ä¶
Get the Tom Kah soup! It‚Äôs so craveable.
Tasty, reasonable prices, attentive staff.
Taan was a perfect waitress. We eat very well. It was a "little bit" spicy for us. It was a cool experience. Thanks Taan ü§ó
hot and fresh
Really good place but quite small so in busy hours it‚Äôs good to make a reservation

I love the food, so far every dish I have tried has been excellent, seems like authentic Thai food as they say if many people from that country eats there it is a compliment to its authenticity.
The service from the workers especially Tang she helps me every time and is so courteous, friendly and helpful.
I am disabled and Tang is always attentive and helpful with entering exiting as well as when I order take she brings it out to my car to save me having to get out, all of this is so amazing and rare in a very busy city like New York.
Thank you for always being you. <3

This is an amazing restaurant! Food is great and not too pricey. The lovely hostess Tane is always very kind and attentive. She also has a great memory and always remembers my order! Definitely give this place a try and tell them Joseph sent you!

I came here for khao soi, and it was amazing. I got the lunch special, which came with spring rolls, and my total bill was just under 20 dollars. Every other place in NYC has khao soi for about 25 dollars, so this place gives you a great bang for your buck. Service was great as well. I will definitely come back to try more on the menu.
Incredible thai food, especially the chomp chomp duck but also the duck soup

Food tasted good, and service was friendly, but after 12-24 hours, both my partner and I experienced similar food poisoning symptoms. We did not share any other meal together other than at Chomp Chomp for dinner. We will not be returning, as something we ate here wasn‚Äôt handled properly.

Some of the best spicy basil pork I've ever had

Great value, small place so not good for large groups
Everything was really good. Great plates, and excellent service.
got takeout from here, everything was very good.
Amazing food and service!
The food is delicious. The place is small and cozy. The service excellent. And the prices are great! 10/10.
Amazing lunch and real value for price. Mock duck is a revelation!

Me and my coworkers almost ordered delivery from this place but decided to call instead and walk there because the weather was nice. It was $12 for the drunken noodles with shrimp on their menu online for the lunch special and $13 on ubereats. We get there and they charged me $16.78. I‚Äôll assume the 78 cents is tax and credit card fee but $16 for a lunch special when it still says $12 on the website? I asked the worker about it while I was paying but she said that they raised the prices a month ago. That‚Äôs fine but why hasn‚Äôt it been updated anywhere and why would it have been cheaper to order pick up via ubereats?

The food was good but this is ultimately a shady spot and I wouldnt trust them or their prices moving forward
The fried fish and the beef short rib curry were great. I‚Äôll definitely be back since there is a lot more I want to try.
Awesome food. Cozy little place what makes it so special too. Highly recommended
Great food, great service. Generous portions. Loved it.
Finally, a drunken noodle that tastes good and is spicy enough üî•‚Ä¶

Really outstanding Thai spot with good lunch specials! Service is always top notch and the depth and flavors of the dishes are truly authentic and well done. Reasonable prices for the lunch special which comes with either soup or spring roll. One note is the Tom Yum soup is more of the traditional type, with a clear & more spicy sour flavor as opposed to the type with coconut milk that you might find in most American Thai spots. Not a criticism by any means, but something to note! Super warm & friendly service, I will be back :)
Sehr leckeres Essen, angemessene Preise, schneller und freundlicher Service und sch√∂nes Ambiente. Man sitzt Eng bei einander
I stopped in here for some lunch, and it was 10/10. My server was lovely, ambiance cozy, and the food was delicious. I‚Äôm not in this neighborhood often, but next time I am, I‚Äôll be back.
Excellent!! Super fast service. Tasty food
FOOD HERE IS 11/10. Our servera were so wonderful, had the best time with my friends here, dear Chomp Chomp staff thank you for a special experience & for making my friends birthday so fun!
so good i want to gatekeep it, hidden gem

actually so so so so good. everything was delicious. thai tea on point. every dish ultra flavorful and full of depth. also such a good diversity of meal options!! i havent had khao soi since being in thailand and this reallllyyyy hit the spot. #goated
Really easy place and cheerful - with, best of all, exceptional Thai food. May it long stay like this.
Restaurant de l‚ÄôEast Village que serveix plats de cuina tailandesa excel.lents. El personal √©s molt amable i t√© una molt bona relaci√≥ qualitat-preu. El local √©s petit i sol estar sempre pl√®.

Authentic Thai place discovered on first trip to NYC. We searched the west coast for this dish and couldn‚Äôt find it anywhere. So we came back :) honestly a better food experience than a lot of the big ‚Äúto eat‚Äù at restaurants in NYC, hands down.

Came across this Thai after our daughter dragged us to a thrift shop she was desperate to explore. So glad she did! Absolute top Thai which ended up being the best meal we had during our NY adventure! Super friendly staff and amazing food! We way over ordered after letting our daughters loose on the menu. Meant we tried a variety of dishes. Cannot recommend enough! ‚ò∫Ô∏è
This is one of our go-to Thai restaurants in the East Village area. Consistent quality and good atmosphere. The small space can fill quickly so RSVP online if you can to avoid a wait.

From the decor to the quality of the dishes this place is so amazing!

Would recommend for an affordable dining experience to catch up with friends & family or to even celebrate a small victory. Such an intimate yet lively setting.
Piatti abbondanti e buonissimi. Personale gentile e disponibile. Prezzi contenuti soprattutto rispetto ai prezzi di NYC. Consigliato assolutamente!!
The food was truly excellent and authentically Thai! Our dish was absolutely delicious! Highly recommended!
Amazing, authentic Thai food. Lunch special was great value as well!
Always reliable and good

Always have the best time at Chomp Chomp, authentic yummy food, with honest prices. Staffs are always welcoming and top at their services! Family style run and lovely vibes as always! Must try, crab fried rice and Thai basil beef!

Authentic thai food. And thai d√©cor. Good to see that the cook is also thai,. Nobody knows those specail thai flavors like a thai cook.
Yum yum or chomp chompü§óü§≠ü§ó

One of the best Thai food I have had in New York City (and I don't say that lightly, because I LOVE and EAT Thai a lot!!). The food was SO TASTY and incredible portions at such reasonable prices. So happy I went!

I don‚Äôt know how I‚Äôve never stumbled upon this place before, and I‚Äôm so grateful that I had an opportunity to enjoy it. Everything from the food to the service and ambience is up my alley! My friend and I got the chicken drunken noodle lunch specials, and the quality blew my expectations. You don‚Äôt always get to find a price point like this for good Thai food every crevice of the city. If you‚Äôre seeing this, take it as a sign to go! üòÅ
The food was crazy. thanks!!
If you order online to pick up the chicken pad Thai is $15 but if you go in to order in person to take away, it's $18. I don't understand the difference.
10/10 look no further. This place is the best Thai food I‚Äôve had in the city. Awesome vibes cool people

Drunken noodle üëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèª Îü∞ÏπòÏÑ∏Ìä∏ Ïù¥Î†áÍ≤å 12Î∂à Ïù¥ÎùºÎãà ÎßõÎèÑ ÏïÑÏ£º ÎßõÏûàÎäîÎç∞ Í∞ÄÍ≤©ÎèÑ Ï¢ãÏïÑÏöî ÎòêÏò¨Í±∞ÏóêÏöî !! Ïù¥Ï†ú ÌÉúÍµ≠Í∞à ÏùºÏùÄ ÏóÜÎÑ§Ïöî.. Îâ¥ÏöïÏóêÎäî ÌÉÄÏù¥ÏßëÏù¥ Ï∞∏ ÎßéÏùÄÎç∞ Ïó¨Í∏∞ ÏÜêÏóêÍºΩÎäî ÌåüÌÉÄÏù¥ÎßõÏßë Ïß±

Really good thai spot! Stopped by last night with some friends and enjoyed all the dishes, everything was soo good, from the shrimp to duck, to pork pad see ew and minced pork dish, flavorful and yummy. Their iced tea was good too!

Highly recommended. Small space though so come early to beat the crowd. Friendly staff!

The spring rolls were my favorite by far, so good we had to order an extra round. The garlic sauce beef was amazing. Between the red and green curry, I preferred the red but both were solid. The rest of the food was okay. Prices were good and portions were generous, but the amount of protein was very low, especially in the curries. Service was outstanding, big shoutout to the team for taking great care of us.

As an avid lover of Thai food, Food was actually good !
The place has limited sittings, so bear in mind if you walk-in with big company.

Tom Yum Chicken was a bit too spicy, but it had lots of protein inside like chicken and etc. and overall experience was pleasant.

Recommend for solo-dining if you‚Äôre looking for something quick and tasty.

Amazing food actually 12/10. I got the pad see ew with shrimp it was amazing. The tom yom soup was beautiful. The pad Thai with chicken was so good. The drunken noodle was really good, but I think that the pad see ew is the best thing on this menu by far. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE and THE PAD SEE EW

This place made me mad. Mad at my stomach for not being big enough. A friend of mine brought me here because they claimed that this place had amazing food. At first, I was skeptical but I was quickly proven wrong. It's a small but cozy restaurant. The prices are really affordable and really worth it for how good it tastes.

I ordered the Khao Soi and the Moo Ping Salad. What came out was a big gorgeous bowl of Thai curry noodles and a plate of grilled pork with a fresh salad + dipping sauce. It smelled delightful and looked stunning.

The Moo Ping was a big pile of grilled pork that paired remarkably with the sauce. It was a bit smoky and sweet. The salad was fresh and clean tasting. Overall, a wonderful start to the meal. If it was a bit more seared/ charred, I think I would like it even more but it's a personal preference. It's already great.

The Khao Soi had many elements that worked together to create a beautiful symphony of flavors.
First off, there was the bow of crispy egg noodles. Despite being fried, it wasn't greasy and was very light. It could be eaten as it is or dipped within the curry. Regardless of the way I ate it, it was great.
Then came the pickled mustard. I'm not a big fan of pickled mustard but it acted as a wonderful touch of acidity for the dish. It helped cleanse the palate and helped the curry shine.
I absolutely loved the choice of raw red onion on the side. Red onion has a sharper and more pungent onion taste than yellow and white onions. The strength of the red onion helped accentuate the fragrance of the dish while perfuming the taste of the curry. It also added some freshness to the rich curry.
The boiled eggs were pretty normal, nothing to complain about. Clean extra protein and very tasty when submerged in the curry for a bit.
The egg noodles were good. It was springy and soft flat noodle and it absorbed a lot of the curry. However, I would have liked it a bit more if it had a little bit more chew to it.

There were two stars in this dish. The savory and fragrant Thai curry + the phenomenal chicken thighs.
The curry was a tad bit spicy (I have low spice tolerance, sorry) but was absolutely delightful. The spice added to the flavor and enticed you to eat more and more. Just when you think it might be too spicy, the coconut milk within the curry soothes the heat and mellows out the spiciness. The coconut added a bit of sweetness and creaminess and enhanced the addictiveness of the dish. It had a velvety and luscious mouth feel. Chomp Chomp also did not skimp out on the spices they added to the soup. I tasted several different spices but the aromatic that stuck out to me was the black cardamom. The salt levels were also perfect. It was savory and filling but it also tasted clean. It's not like those restaurants where you have to sleep after you finished eating. Here, you're full and have energy.

The chicken thighs was pretty much perfect. It was cooked in the coconut curry until it was tender. The chicken thighs fell apart when I picked it up with chopsticks. Have you heard of the saying fall off the bone? This is a step up from that. These were boneless chicken thighs and they were so tender, they fell off the meat. This made the chicken aromatic and infused it with so much flavor. It was sweet but also had all spices from the curry permeating through it. The chicken was at the bottom of the bowl so it's not shown in the picture but there was so much meat. I went here a week ago and I still dream of this chicken. It was so good that I had to order delivery the day after coming here. It's astounding how tasty it was.

TLDR: Close to perfect place. COME HERE. You will not regret it. Huge portion and affordable prices and really delicious food. Probably the best use of $25 that I made in 2025

Such a cute little spot - came on a fairly cold day but the interior is warm and cozy! Got the lunch special on a weekend which is always appreciated. $11 for some of the crispiest spring rolls and a generous portion of drunken noodles. Everything was delicious and the service was impeccable!

When arrived there were no waiting time, meanwhile some other Thai restaurant has lined up long already. Nice and proficient waiter staffs and delicious plates. I can totally feel why they got 4.9! Such high rate and well-deserved!
My friend and I got the pad thai, it was overall good but by the end of our lunch she found a hair in her meat. People came in for quick bites and have plenty of seats.
Really authentic and tasty Thai street food! Everything we ordered was good and what‚Äôs best is that we didn‚Äôt have to wait for a table on a Sat night!

This place is legit! I loved their Som Tham (papaya salad). It reminded me of a restaurant in Bangkok.  This place is BYOB, so bring your beers and wine! The service here was phenomenal.  We came here after eating omakase sushi meal at Shinzo, but we loved everything.  Definitely worth a try.

Absolutely amazing prices for excellent prices and good quality food! The fried tofu (5/5) was incredible - crispy, hot, bit silky on the inside. The khao soi (4/5) was well flavored and the potions? Wow wee they literally put in 3 chicken thighs and it fed me for 2 days after. It's literally giant. Tom Kha (4.5/5) was also delicious! Service was also amazing!

I would say this is the officially the best Thai food in the city. It is very flavorful. The price and the quantity is unbeatable. I had so many BBQ pork in all Thai places. But this place overdone itself. The papaya salad is classic and cannot go wrong.

Whoa! I really loved this place. The food was SUPER DELICIOUS and I have to come back. The curry puffs were divine and I could‚Äôve eaten five more üòÇThe Khao Kra Pow Khai Dao, medium heat, with minced pork left my taste buds dancing with joy! I‚Äôd even go back to get the next spice level up. I‚Äôve always seen this place and I don‚Äôt regret visiting. It won‚Äôt be the last time. Also, the Thai iced tea is so REFRESHING and done just right. I would recommend coming earlier in the evening because it does get packed. It‚Äôs a small location, but that only adds to its charm. Service was great as well! üòç‚ò∫Ô∏è

So affordable and delicious, $15 for the best meal I‚Äôve had in New York this whole trip! Try the special - Kai Sam Ros ( crispy chicken thighs with sweet chilli sauce) so so good. Amazing service and food came quick, didn‚Äôt need a reservation

The staff were so welcoming, kind and helpful. The fried tofu was nice and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The sauce provided with the tofu was delicious and the perfect amount! The drunken noodles with tofu were also really good. The Kai Sam Ros was absolutely delicious!! The chicken was crispy and the sauces paired perfectly with the chicken. Would highly recommend the Kai Sam Ros!

Delicious and cozy! We called ahead (about an hour and a half prior) for a table of five and they were able to book us. I ordered Khao Nar Ped (roasted duck over rice with Chinese broccoli and pickled ginger). The duck was amazing. It melted in your mouth. I also tried Thai Iced Tea for the first time. It‚Äôs incredible! I‚Äôm including a photo of before and after I stirred it (in case that matters). Our glasses of water were also NEVER empty. The waitress never let the water get an inch lower than the top of the glass!

My favorite and also the best Thai place in NYC. The food is excellent and the servers are always friendly. I‚Äôve tried many different foods from here and everything was so delicious. Definitely recommend this place If you want to try really good Thai food.

Adorable restaurant in a nice location. Menu had a variety of dishes which were all delicious! I got the Drunken Noodles which were underwhelming in terms of spice (definitely ask for them to make it extra spicy or at least above medium spicy). Great ambience and lovely service. Will definitely go back when I‚Äôm craving Thai food

We were pleasantly surprised with our visit to Chomp Chomp. The restaurant is arguably small, and making reservations is highly recommended.

They don‚Äôt serve any alcoholic drinks, but on the good side, they‚Äôre BYOB. For an appetizer, we shared chicken wings with sweet chili sauce and ordered a bowl of chicken Tom Yum soup that is good for two people.

For our main entree, we shared stir-fried rice with crab meat and eggs and paired it with fried seafood with traditional Thai curry sauce. (We gave plus 1 star to this dish as the fried seafood was not swimming in curry sauce.)

It truly exceeded our expectations from this restaurant. From price point, customer service, and flavor of each and every dish. If you are in the Lower East Side and craving some authentic Thai dishes, this place is worth a visit.

I came here with my sister, and the food was amazing! The service was also incredible. We were looking to try Thai food, and this place was the closest to where we were. I wasn‚Äôt sure about it since I had never heard of it before, but oh my, it was definitely worth it! The portions were generous, the quality was excellent, and the price was super fair‚Äîgreat food for a great deal!
What a delicious gem. Incredible lunch specials. Scrumptious green curry and a wonderful Thai tea.

Hidden gem for real Thai food lovers! The restaurant itself is small and cozy. Their dishes are delicious and authentic! The portions are huge and are difficult to finish. The winner for the evening was clearly the Khao Soi! But you cannot do anything wrong here! Just come in and try a you‚Äôll love it!

Probably not the same owner but the spot here before was also thai, and it was very delicious. This new spot is just as delicious, if not more. Just look how beautiful these noodles are! Might go back today. The lunch special is definitely needed, and is such a good deal, thank you!

Update: I've been going back more times than I expected to, and it gets better every time. I love the food, the staff, their hospitality very much. Please don't change.

Pad Thai chicken is a bomb!! Lunch special only 11.98 USD comes with 2 veggies spring rolls or Tom yum soup. Cute small restaurant with a great services of the girls working there. 10 out of 10.
Will try another dishes next time.
Really recommended. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

I came here straight after arriving at my hotel in NYC, and it did not disappoint! The food was incredibly fresh, the prices were excellent, and the service was outstanding. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back whenever I‚Äôm in the area!

Came across this place from a quick google search for Asian food near me. It was absolutely delicious. Fresh, tasty, and excellent service. We had the corn salad, curry puffs, and the Khao soi with sticky rice. All of which were a 10/10, and for a great price. Quick service and friendly staff. Highly recommend

Honestly ? Don‚Äôt walk past if you want a good Thai meal . Flavorful meals , good portions , great ambience and decor , the kind man that attended to us . It was a great first restaurant of the year welcome ! I am definitely going back .
Food is made fresh so consider  that for wait time , my friends also enjoyed the mint , like and cucumber . infused water they served

Cute small place in a busy part of the LES. got the Tom kha, tofu pad Thai and eggplant basil with tofu‚Äî it was delicious, a good portion, and not too greasy. Thai iced tea is a bit too sweet for our liking.
The pad Thai was delicious. There‚Äôs lots of options and the spring rolls were great too.

Food is flavorful and well-priced. The iced coffee and iced tea are both refreshing! If being extra critical, I wish the lighting is slightly dimmed so the vibe would be even better.
Great and tasty Thai flavors at ‚Äúsecret‚Äù boutique food spot. Value for money and nice service.
